snippet: Lieut. Gov. Gray Davis said today that he would accept a hefty raise when he was sworn in as Governor. But with a possible budget deficit of more than $1 billion looming, Mr. Davis will knock 5 percent off the new salary, and he will ask all his a...
lead_paragraph: Lieut. Gov. Gray Davis said today that he would accept a hefty raise when he was sworn in as Governor. But with a possible budget deficit of more than $1 billion looming, Mr. Davis will knock 5 percent off the new salary, and he will ask all his appointees to do the same. Gov. Pete Wilson's pay went up from $131,041 to $165,000 today, and Mr. Davis is entitled to the same. By taking what he called ''a 5 percent pay cut,'' his salary will be $156,750.
abstract: Lieut Gov Gray Davis says he will accept hefty raise when sworn in as Governor of California, but that with possible budget deficit of more than $1 billion looming, he will knock 5 percent off new salary, and he will ask all appointees to do same (S)

headline.main: New Governor Takes Just Part of a Raise
